properties.title: hurriedly pack up tent before it starts pouring
properties.description: I woke up and it still hadn’t rained yet, so at the ripe hour of six I quickly packed up camp. With little keeping me at the campsite, I made my way to the bike trail.

properties.title: wait out crazy downpour under i90 bridge
properties.description: Shortly into my ride, the first large squall of the day hit. I rushed to get under the I-90 to keep dry. I waited there for a while for the rain intensity to subside before getting back on the bike.

properties.title: just barely make it to pemberton iga grocery store before second thunderstorm
properties.description: I made it to Pemberton mostly dry, just as the second large storm of the day was passing through. After buying a rough equivalent of breakfast at the Pemberton IGA, I hung around, waiting for the thunder to pass.

properties.title: make it to flatlands coffee mostly dry and enjoy incredible coffee and buy beans for adrian
properties.description: I spent close to three hours in the Flatlands Coffee shop, which Adrian had told me to visit. There I had an amazing pourover and watched the storms go by as I charged my phone and caught up with friends via text. I also caught up on the Mariners win streak - fourteen games as of the time of writing. Outside the coffee shop, an older lady gave me a brief history of Bowling Green’s main street. She also told me to hug someone and that smiles were hugs. We both complained about the loud cars passing by, interrupting our conversation. Inside, I met someone who had come to Bowling Green by walking all the way from Pittsburgh. He was fun to chat with and wished me well for the rest of my trip.

properties.title: make it to gas station in light rain
properties.description: After my second coffee, the rain let up a little, so I decided to get on with the second half of my day. I made it to Weston, where I made a meal of beef jerky, a Nature Valley bar, and water.

properties.title: rain has subsided and i'm going gigafast
enjoy surprisingly good pizza and fries in tiny town with no other businesses
properties.description: The pizza place in Florida, apparently the last solvent business in town, served me surprisingly good pizza and home fries. I also had some ice cream and took their two remaining water bottles.

properties.title: why am i doing a 15 minute loop just to get to a crappy campground
set up tent uberquick before rain comes back and hide out in it for like 4 hours before sleep
properties.description: I got to the campground under spitting rain and quickly set up my tent. Right after I pitched it, heavy rain set in. I called dad, updated him on the trip, and caught up with friends. The rain is still driving, so I hope that my tent setup is sound. I do not want to be soaking wet as I wake up tomorrow. Hopefully, the rain will subside by morning and I will have a dry-ish day tomorrow.
